Use natural remedies: One could use natural remedies like ginger tea, honey, and lemon to help alleviate symptoms of a cold. Ginger has anti-inflammatory properties that can help soothe the throat, while honey has antibacterial properties that can help fight off infections. Lemon can also help to boost the immune system and fight off cold-causing viruses.
Get plenty of rest: Rest is key to recovering from a cold. It allows the body to focus its energy on fighting off the infection and healing itself.
Stay hydrated: Drinking plenty of fluids can help to loosen congestion, keep the throat moist, and prevent dehydration.

Use essential oils: Essential oils like eucalyptus and peppermint can help to clear congestion and soothe the throat. Eucalyptus has natural decongestant properties, while peppermint can help to soothe the throat and relieve headaches.

Use homeopathy: Homeopathy is a form of alternative medicine that uses natural substances to treat illnesses. Some common homeopathic remedies for colds include arsenicum album, gelsemium, and eucalyptus globulus. These remedies are believed to help boost the immune system and fight off cold-causing viruses.
